CVE-2013-4966.title: Puppet Enterprise Bugs Let Remote Users Impersonate the Console and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2013-4966.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Puppet Enterprise (PE). A remote user can impersonate the PE console. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.The PE master external node classification script does not verify the identity of the PE console [CVE-2013-4966]. A remote user can impersonate the PE console and submit arbitrary classification to the target master.A remote user can gain read access to the node endpoint in the console [CVE-2013-4971].
CVE-2013-4966.extra: A remote user can impersonate the PE console.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2013-4971.title: Puppet Enterprise Bugs Let Remote Users Impersonate the Console and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2013-4971.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Puppet Enterprise (PE). A remote user can impersonate the PE console. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.The PE master external node classification script does not verify the identity of the PE console [CVE-2013-4966]. A remote user can impersonate the PE console and submit arbitrary classification to the target master.A remote user can gain read access to the node endpoint in the console [CVE-2013-4971].
CVE-2013-4971.extra: A remote user can impersonate the PE console.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2013-5042.title: ASP.NET SignalR Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-5042.body: A vulnerability was reported in ASP.NET. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the ASP.NET software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Microsoft Visual Studio Team Foundation Server 2013 is also affected.
CVE-2013-5042.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the ASP.NET software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-5095.title: Juniper Junos Space Bugs Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Remote Authenticated Users Modify the Configuration and Obtain Authentication Information
CVE-2013-5095.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Juniper Junos Space. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote authenticated user can modify the configuration. A remote authenticated user can obtain authentication information.The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2013-5095]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Juniper Junos Space web interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access information acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned PR 884469 to this vulnerability.A remote authenticated user with read-only privileges can exploit a flaw in the role-based access control implementation to make configuration changes [CVE-2013-5096].The vendor has assigned PR 863804 to this vulnerability.A remote authenticated user can obtain a list of users and their MD5 password hashes [CVE-2013-5097].The vendor has assigned PR 879462 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5095.extra: A remote user can take actions on the web interface acting as the target user.A remote authenticated user can modify the configuration.A remote authenticated user can obtain authentication information.

CVE-2013-5122.title: Linksys Router Installation/Upgrade Flaw Lets Remote Users Gain Administrative Access
CVE-2013-5122.body: A vulnerability was reported in some Linksys Routers. A remote user can gain administrative access to the target system.During the installation and upgrade process, a remote user can connect to TCP port 8083 on the WAN interface to access portions of the administrative interface even though the console indicates that remote access is disabled.On some systems, TCP port 443 may also be open.The vendor was notified in July 2013.Kyle Lovett and Matt Claunch reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5122.extra: A remote user can gain administrative access on the target system.

CVE-2013-5125.title: Apple iOS Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Deny Service, Obtain Information, and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Let Applications Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2013-5125.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Apple iOS. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. An application can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can bypass the screen lock.A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted IPv6 ICMP packets to cause excessive CPU resource consumption on the target system [CVE-2011-2391]. Marc Heuse reported this vulnerability.An application can bypass passcode-attempt limits to attempt to determine the target user's passcode [CVE-2013-0957]. Jin Han of the Institute for Infocomm Research working with Qiang Yan and Su Mon Kywe of Singapore Management University reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption flaw in the processing of XML files and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2013-1036]. Kai Lu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code [CVE-2013-1037, CVE-2013-1038, CVE-2013-1039, CVE-2013-1040, CVE-2013-1041, CVE-2013-1042, CVE-2013-1043, CVE-2013-1044, CVE-2013-1045, CVE-2013-1046, CVE-2013-1047]. Google Chrome Security Team, own-hero Research (via iDefense VCP), Apple, and miaubiz reported this vulnerability.A remote user that can cause arbitrary code execution may be able to cause the code to persist across reboots due to buffer overflows in the dyld openSharedCacheFile() function [CVE-2013-3950]. Stefan Esser reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the mach_port_space_info API to gain kernel level privileges [CVE-2013-3953]. Stefan Esser reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the posix_spawn API to gain kernel level privileges [CVE-2013-3954]. Stefan Esser reported this vulnerability.A user that can mount a non-HFS filesystem can exploit a flaw in the processing of AppleDouble files to execute arbitrary with kernel privileges [CVE-2013-3955]. Stefan Esser reported this vulnerability.A remote user may be able to exploit a flaw in the generation of Personal Hotspot passwords to predict the password and join the target user's Personal Hotspot [CVE-2013-4616]. Andreas Kurtz of NESO Security Labs and Daniel Metz of University Erlangen-Nuremberg reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption flaw in WebKit and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2013-5125, CVE-2013-5126, CVE-2013-5127, CVE-2013-5128] Google Chrome Security Team and Apple reported this vulnerability.Dragging or pasting a selection may allow cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2013-5129]. Mario Heiderich reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary scripting code in the context of another site [CVE-2013-5131]. Erling A Ellingsen reported this vulnerability.A remote user that can intercept network traffic may be able to use a TrustWave sub-CA certificate to access user credentials or other sensitive information [CVE-2013-5134].A background application can inject user interface events into the foreground application [CVE-2013-5137]. Mackenzie Straight at Mobile Labs reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger a null pointer dereference in IOCatalogue and cause the system to crash [CVE-2013-5138]. Will Estes reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger an array access flaw in the IOSerialFamily driver and execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges [CVE-2013-5139]. @dent1zt reported this vulnerability.A remote user can send a specially crafted packet fragment to cause the target device to restart [CVE-2013-5140]. Joonas Kuorilehto of Codenomicon, an anonymousresearcher (via CERT-FI), Antti LevomAki and Lauri Virtanen of Vulnerability Analysis Group, and Stonesoft reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger an integer truncation flaw to cause the CPU to enter an infinite loop [CVE-2013-5141]. CESG reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the msgctl and segctl APIs to access the contents of kernel stack memory [CVE-2013-5142]. Kenzley Alphonse of Kenx Technology, Inc reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in kextd in the handling of IPC messages from unauthenticated senders [CVE-2013-5145]. "Rainbow PRISM" reported this vulnerability.An application may be able to access a push notification token when the user has not provided permission [CVE-2013-5149]. Jack Flintermann of Grouper, Inc. reported this vulnerability.A physically local user can view the history of pages recently visited in an open tab after clearing the Safari history [CVE-2013-5150].A remote user can create a specially crafted web site file rendered with the 'Content-Type: text/plain' header that, when viewed by the target user, will allow cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2013-5151]. Ben Toews of Github reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will display an arbitrary URL [CVE-2013-5152]. Keita Haga of keitahaga.com and Lukasz Pilorz of RBS reported this vulnerability.A physically local user with a device in Lost Mode may be able to view notifications [CVE-2013-5153]. Daniel Stangroom reported this vulnerability.Script applications are not properly sandboxed. An application may be able to run without a sandbox [CVE-2013-5154]. evad3rs reported this vulnerability.An application can write specific values to the /dev/random device to cause the CPU to enter an infinite loop [CVE-2013-5155]. CESG reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the telephony subsystem to to bypass supported APIs and control or interfere with the telephony daemon [CVE-2013-5156]. Jin Han of the Institute for Infocomm Research working with Qiang Yan and Su Mon Kywe of Singapore Management University reported this vulnerability. Tielei Wang, Kangjie Lu, Long Lu, Simon Chung, and Wenke Lee from the Georgia Institute of Technology also reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the Twitter subsystem to bypass supported APIs and control or interfere with the Twitter system daemon [CVE-2013-5157]. Jin Han of the Institute for Infocomm Research working with Qiang Yan and Su Mon Kywe of Singapore Management University reported this vulnerability. Tielei Wang, Kangjie Lu, Long Lu, Simon Chung, and Wenke Lee from the Georgia Institute of Technology also reported this vulnerability.On systems with no passcode, a user can exploit a flaw in the Twitter icon cache determine the Twitter accounts that the target user had recently interacted with [CVE-2013-5158]. Jonathan Zdziarski reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a flaw in the the window.webkitRequestAnimationFrame() API and obtain information from the target user's system [CVE-2013-5159].

Andreas Kurtz of NESO Security Labs and Daniel Metz of University Erlangen-Nuremberg reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption flaw in WebKit and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2013-5125, CVE-2013-5126, CVE-2013-5127, CVE-2013-5128] Google Chrome Security Team and Apple reported this vulnerability.Dragging or pasting a selection may allow cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2013-5129]. Mario Heiderich reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary scripting code in the context of another site [CVE-2013-5131]. Erling A Ellingsen reported this vulnerability.A remote user that can intercept network traffic may be able to use a TrustWave sub-CA certificate to access user credentials or other sensitive information [CVE-2013-5134].A background application can inject user interface events into the foreground application [CVE-2013-5137]. Mackenzie Straight at Mobile Labs reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger a null pointer dereference in IOCatalogue and cause the system to crash [CVE-2013-5138]. Will Estes reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger an array access flaw in the IOSerialFamily driver and execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges [CVE-2013-5139]. @dent1zt reported this vulnerability.A remote user can send a specially crafted packet fragment to cause the target device to restart [CVE-2013-5140]. Joonas Kuorilehto of Codenomicon, an anonymousresearcher (via CERT-FI), Antti LevomAki and Lauri Virtanen of Vulnerability Analysis Group, and Stonesoft reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger an integer truncation flaw to cause the CPU to enter an infinite loop [CVE-2013-5141]. CESG reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the msgctl and segctl APIs to access the contents of kernel stack memory [CVE-2013-5142]. Kenzley Alphonse of Kenx Technology, Inc reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in kextd in the handling of IPC messages from unauthenticated senders [CVE-2013-5145]. "Rainbow PRISM" reported this vulnerability.An application may be able to access a push notification token when the user has not provided permission [CVE-2013-5149]. Jack Flintermann of Grouper, Inc. reported this vulnerability.A physically local user can view the history of pages recently visited in an open tab after clearing the Safari history [CVE-2013-5150].A remote user can create a specially crafted web site file rendered with the 'Content-Type: text/plain' header that, when viewed by the target user, will allow cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2013-5151]. Ben Toews of Github reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will display an arbitrary URL [CVE-2013-5152]. Keita Haga of keitahaga.com and Lukasz Pilorz of RBS reported this vulnerability.A physically local user with a device in Lost Mode may be able to view notifications [CVE-2013-5153]. Daniel Stangroom reported this vulnerability.Script applications are not properly sandboxed. An application may be able to run without a sandbox [CVE-2013-5154]. evad3rs reported this vulnerability.An application can write specific values to the /dev/random device to cause the CPU to enter an infinite loop [CVE-2013-5155]. CESG reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the telephony subsystem to to bypass supported APIs and control or interfere with the telephony daemon [CVE-2013-5156]. Jin Han of the Institute for Infocomm Research working with Qiang Yan and Su Mon Kywe of Singapore Management University reported this vulnerability. CESG reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the msgctl and segctl APIs to access the contents of kernel stack memory [CVE-2013-5142]. Kenzley Alphonse of Kenx Technology, Inc reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in kextd in the handling of IPC messages from unauthenticated senders [CVE-2013-5145]. "Rainbow PRISM" reported this vulnerability.An application may be able to access a push notification token when the user has not provided permission [CVE-2013-5149]. Jack Flintermann of Grouper, Inc. reported this vulnerability.A physically local user can view the history of pages recently visited in an open tab after clearing the Safari history [CVE-2013-5150].A remote user can create a specially crafted web site file rendered with the 'Content-Type: text/plain' header that, when viewed by the target user, will allow cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2013-5151]. Ben Toews of Github reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will display an arbitrary URL [CVE-2013-5152]. Keita Haga of keitahaga.com and Lukasz Pilorz of RBS reported this vulnerability.A physically local user with a device in Lost Mode may be able to view notifications [CVE-2013-5153]. Daniel Stangroom reported this vulnerability.Script applications are not properly sandboxed. An application may be able to run without a sandbox [CVE-2013-5154]. evad3rs reported this vulnerability.An application can write specific values to the /dev/random device to cause the CPU to enter an infinite loop [CVE-2013-5155]. CESG reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the telephony subsystem to to bypass supported APIs and control or interfere with the telephony daemon [CVE-2013-5156]. Jin Han of the Institute for Infocomm Research working with Qiang Yan and Su Mon Kywe of Singapore Management University reported this vulnerability. Tielei Wang, Kangjie Lu, Long Lu, Simon Chung, and Wenke Lee from the Georgia Institute of Technology also reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the Twitter subsystem to bypass supported APIs and control or interfere with the Twitter system daemon [CVE-2013-5157]. Jin Han of the Institute for Infocomm Research working with Qiang Yan and Su Mon Kywe of Singapore Management University reported this vulnerability. Tielei Wang, Kangjie Lu, Long Lu, Simon Chung, and Wenke Lee from the Georgia Institute of Technology also reported this vulnerability.On systems with no passcode, a user can exploit a flaw in the Twitter icon cache determine the Twitter accounts that the target user had recently interacted with [CVE-2013-5158]. Jonathan Zdziarski reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a flaw in the the window.webkitRequestAnimationFrame() API and obtain information from the target user's system [CVE-2013-5159].
CVE-2013-5140.extra: A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.An application can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can bypass the screen lock.

CESG reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the telephony subsystem to to bypass supported APIs and control or interfere with the telephony daemon [CVE-2013-5156]. Jin Han of the Institute for Infocomm Research working with Qiang Yan and Su Mon Kywe of Singapore Management University reported this vulnerability. Tielei Wang, Kangjie Lu, Long Lu, Simon Chung, and Wenke Lee from the Georgia Institute of Technology also reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the Twitter subsystem to bypass supported APIs and control or interfere with the Twitter system daemon [CVE-2013-5157]. Jin Han of the Institute for Infocomm Research working with Qiang Yan and Su Mon Kywe of Singapore Management University reported this vulnerability. Tielei Wang, Kangjie Lu, Long Lu, Simon Chung, and Wenke Lee from the Georgia Institute of Technology also reported this vulnerability.On systems with no passcode, a user can exploit a flaw in the Twitter icon cache determine the Twitter accounts that the target user had recently interacted with [CVE-2013-5158]. Jonathan Zdziarski reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a flaw in the the window.webkitRequestAnimationFrame() API and obtain information from the target user's system [CVE-2013-5159].

CVE-2013-5150.title: Apple iOS Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Deny Service, Obtain Information, and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Let Applications Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2013-5150.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Apple iOS. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. An application can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can bypass the screen lock.A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted IPv6 ICMP packets to cause excessive CPU resource consumption on the target system [CVE-2011-2391]. Marc Heuse reported this vulnerability.An application can bypass passcode-attempt limits to attempt to determine the target user's passcode [CVE-2013-0957]. Jin Han of the Institute for Infocomm Research working with Qiang Yan and Su Mon Kywe of Singapore Management University reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption flaw in the processing of XML files and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2013-1036]. Kai Lu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code [CVE-2013-1037, CVE-2013-1038, CVE-2013-1039, CVE-2013-1040, CVE-2013-1041, CVE-2013-1042, CVE-2013-1043, CVE-2013-1044, CVE-2013-1045, CVE-2013-1046, CVE-2013-1047]. Google Chrome Security Team, own-hero Research (via iDefense VCP), Apple, and miaubiz reported this vulnerability.A remote user that can cause arbitrary code execution may be able to cause the code to persist across reboots due to buffer overflows in the dyld openSharedCacheFile() function [CVE-2013-3950]. Stefan Esser reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the mach_port_space_info API to gain kernel level privileges [CVE-2013-3953]. Stefan Esser reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the posix_spawn API to gain kernel level privileges [CVE-2013-3954]. Stefan Esser reported this vulnerability.A user that can mount a non-HFS filesystem can exploit a flaw in the processing of AppleDouble files to execute arbitrary with kernel privileges [CVE-2013-3955]. Stefan Esser reported this vulnerability.A remote user may be able to exploit a flaw in the generation of Personal Hotspot passwords to predict the password and join the target user's Personal Hotspot [CVE-2013-4616]. Andreas Kurtz of NESO Security Labs and Daniel Metz of University Erlangen-Nuremberg reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption flaw in WebKit and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2013-5125, CVE-2013-5126, CVE-2013-5127, CVE-2013-5128] Google Chrome Security Team and Apple reported this vulnerability.Dragging or pasting a selection may allow cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2013-5129]. Mario Heiderich reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary scripting code in the context of another site [CVE-2013-5131]. Erling A Ellingsen reported this vulnerability.A remote user that can intercept network traffic may be able to use a TrustWave sub-CA certificate to access user credentials or other sensitive information [CVE-2013-5134].A background application can inject user interface events into the foreground application [CVE-2013-5137]. Mackenzie Straight at Mobile Labs reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger a null pointer dereference in IOCatalogue and cause the system to crash [CVE-2013-5138]. Will Estes reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger an array access flaw in the IOSerialFamily driver and execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges [CVE-2013-5139]. @dent1zt reported this vulnerability.A remote user can send a specially crafted packet fragment to cause the target device to restart [CVE-2013-5140]. Joonas Kuorilehto of Codenomicon, an anonymousresearcher (via CERT-FI), Antti LevomAki and Lauri Virtanen of Vulnerability Analysis Group, and Stonesoft reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger an integer truncation flaw to cause the CPU to enter an infinite loop [CVE-2013-5141]. CESG reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the msgctl and segctl APIs to access the contents of kernel stack memory [CVE-2013-5142]. Kenzley Alphonse of Kenx Technology, Inc reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in kextd in the handling of IPC messages from unauthenticated senders [CVE-2013-5145]. "Rainbow PRISM" reported this vulnerability.An application may be able to access a push notification token when the user has not provided permission [CVE-2013-5149]. Jack Flintermann of Grouper, Inc. reported this vulnerability.A physically local user can view the history of pages recently visited in an open tab after clearing the Safari history [CVE-2013-5150].A remote user can create a specially crafted web site file rendered with the 'Content-Type: text/plain' header that, when viewed by the target user, will allow cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2013-5151]. Ben Toews of Github reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will display an arbitrary URL [CVE-2013-5152]. Keita Haga of keitahaga.com and Lukasz Pilorz of RBS reported this vulnerability.A physically local user with a device in Lost Mode may be able to view notifications [CVE-2013-5153]. Daniel Stangroom reported this vulnerability.Script applications are not properly sandboxed. An application may be able to run without a sandbox [CVE-2013-5154]. evad3rs reported this vulnerability.An application can write specific values to the /dev/random device to cause the CPU to enter an infinite loop [CVE-2013-5155]. CESG reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the telephony subsystem to to bypass supported APIs and control or interfere with the telephony daemon [CVE-2013-5156]. Jin Han of the Institute for Infocomm Research working with Qiang Yan and Su Mon Kywe of Singapore Management University reported this vulnerability. Tielei Wang, Kangjie Lu, Long Lu, Simon Chung, and Wenke Lee from the Georgia Institute of Technology also reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the Twitter subsystem to bypass supported APIs and control or interfere with the Twitter system daemon [CVE-2013-5157]. Jin Han of the Institute for Infocomm Research working with Qiang Yan and Su Mon Kywe of Singapore Management University reported this vulnerability. Tielei Wang, Kangjie Lu, Long Lu, Simon Chung, and Wenke Lee from the Georgia Institute of Technology also reported this vulnerability.On systems with no passcode, a user can exploit a flaw in the Twitter icon cache determine the Twitter accounts that the target user had recently interacted with [CVE-2013-5158]. Jonathan Zdziarski reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a flaw in the the window.webkitRequestAnimationFrame() API and obtain information from the target user's system [CVE-2013-5159].

CVE-2013-5154.title: Apple iOS Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Deny Service, Obtain Information, and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Let Applications Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2013-5154.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Apple iOS. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. An application can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can bypass the screen lock.A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted IPv6 ICMP packets to cause excessive CPU resource consumption on the target system [CVE-2011-2391]. Marc Heuse reported this vulnerability.An application can bypass passcode-attempt limits to attempt to determine the target user's passcode [CVE-2013-0957]. Jin Han of the Institute for Infocomm Research working with Qiang Yan and Su Mon Kywe of Singapore Management University reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption flaw in the processing of XML files and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2013-1036]. Kai Lu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code [CVE-2013-1037, CVE-2013-1038, CVE-2013-1039, CVE-2013-1040, CVE-2013-1041, CVE-2013-1042, CVE-2013-1043, CVE-2013-1044, CVE-2013-1045, CVE-2013-1046, CVE-2013-1047]. Google Chrome Security Team, own-hero Research (via iDefense VCP), Apple, and miaubiz reported this vulnerability.A remote user that can cause arbitrary code execution may be able to cause the code to persist across reboots due to buffer overflows in the dyld openSharedCacheFile() function [CVE-2013-3950]. Stefan Esser reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the mach_port_space_info API to gain kernel level privileges [CVE-2013-3953]. Stefan Esser reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the posix_spawn API to gain kernel level privileges [CVE-2013-3954]. Stefan Esser reported this vulnerability.A user that can mount a non-HFS filesystem can exploit a flaw in the processing of AppleDouble files to execute arbitrary with kernel privileges [CVE-2013-3955]. Stefan Esser reported this vulnerability.A remote user may be able to exploit a flaw in the generation of Personal Hotspot passwords to predict the password and join the target user's Personal Hotspot [CVE-2013-4616]. Andreas Kurtz of NESO Security Labs and Daniel Metz of University Erlangen-Nuremberg reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption flaw in WebKit and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2013-5125, CVE-2013-5126, CVE-2013-5127, CVE-2013-5128] Google Chrome Security Team and Apple reported this vulnerability.Dragging or pasting a selection may allow cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2013-5129]. Mario Heiderich reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary scripting code in the context of another site [CVE-2013-5131]. Erling A Ellingsen reported this vulnerability.A remote user that can intercept network traffic may be able to use a TrustWave sub-CA certificate to access user credentials or other sensitive information [CVE-2013-5134].A background application can inject user interface events into the foreground application [CVE-2013-5137]. Mackenzie Straight at Mobile Labs reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger a null pointer dereference in IOCatalogue and cause the system to crash [CVE-2013-5138]. Will Estes reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger an array access flaw in the IOSerialFamily driver and execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges [CVE-2013-5139]. @dent1zt reported this vulnerability.A remote user can send a specially crafted packet fragment to cause the target device to restart [CVE-2013-5140]. Joonas Kuorilehto of Codenomicon, an anonymousresearcher (via CERT-FI), Antti LevomAki and Lauri Virtanen of Vulnerability Analysis Group, and Stonesoft reported this vulnerability.An application can trigger an integer truncation flaw to cause the CPU to enter an infinite loop [CVE-2013-5141]. CESG reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the msgctl and segctl APIs to access the contents of kernel stack memory [CVE-2013-5142]. Kenzley Alphonse of Kenx Technology, Inc reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in kextd in the handling of IPC messages from unauthenticated senders [CVE-2013-5145]. "Rainbow PRISM" reported this vulnerability.An application may be able to access a push notification token when the user has not provided permission [CVE-2013-5149]. Jack Flintermann of Grouper, Inc. reported this vulnerability.A physically local user can view the history of pages recently visited in an open tab after clearing the Safari history [CVE-2013-5150].A remote user can create a specially crafted web site file rendered with the 'Content-Type: text/plain' header that, when viewed by the target user, will allow cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2013-5151]. Ben Toews of Github reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will display an arbitrary URL [CVE-2013-5152]. Keita Haga of keitahaga.com and Lukasz Pilorz of RBS reported this vulnerability.A physically local user with a device in Lost Mode may be able to view notifications [CVE-2013-5153]. Daniel Stangroom reported this vulnerability.Script applications are not properly sandboxed. An application may be able to run without a sandbox [CVE-2013-5154]. evad3rs reported this vulnerability.An application can write specific values to the /dev/random device to cause the CPU to enter an infinite loop [CVE-2013-5155]. CESG reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the telephony subsystem to to bypass supported APIs and control or interfere with the telephony daemon [CVE-2013-5156]. Jin Han of the Institute for Infocomm Research working with Qiang Yan and Su Mon Kywe of Singapore Management University reported this vulnerability. Tielei Wang, Kangjie Lu, Long Lu, Simon Chung, and Wenke Lee from the Georgia Institute of Technology also reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the Twitter subsystem to bypass supported APIs and control or interfere with the Twitter system daemon [CVE-2013-5157]. Jin Han of the Institute for Infocomm Research working with Qiang Yan and Su Mon Kywe of Singapore Management University reported this vulnerability. Tielei Wang, Kangjie Lu, Long Lu, Simon Chung, and Wenke Lee from the Georgia Institute of Technology also reported this vulnerability.On systems with no passcode, a user can exploit a flaw in the Twitter icon cache determine the Twitter accounts that the target user had recently interacted with [CVE-2013-5158]. Jonathan Zdziarski reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a flaw in the the window.webkitRequestAnimationFrame() API and obtain information from the target user's system [CVE-2013-5159].
CVE-2013-5154.extra: A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.An application can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can bypass the screen lock.

Tielei Wang, Kangjie Lu, Long Lu, Simon Chung, and Wenke Lee from the Georgia Institute of Technology also reported this vulnerability.An application can exploit a flaw in the Twitter subsystem to bypass supported APIs and control or interfere with the Twitter system daemon [CVE-2013-5157]. An application can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. CVE-2013-5209.title: FreeBSD SCTP Discloses Portions of Kernel Memory Contents to Remote Users
CVE-2013-5209.body: A vulnerability was reported in FreeBSD. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.When the kernel initializes the SCTP state cookie for INIT-ACK chunks, a buffer allocated from the kernel stack is not properly initialized. As a result, fragments of kernel memory may be transmitted within SCTP packets over the network.Julian Seward and Michael Tuexen reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5209.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information from kernel memory.

CVE-2013-5211.title: IBM AIX ntpd Query Function Lets Remote Users Conduct Amplified Denial of Service Attacks
CVE-2013-5211.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX. A remote user can conduct amplified denial of service attacks.A remote user can exploit an administrative query function in ntpd to amplify distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks against other sites.Additional information is available from US-CERT at:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/348126
CVE-2013-5211.extra: A remote user can conduct amplified denial of service attacks against other sites.

CVE-2013-5349.title: Google Picasa File Parsing Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2013-5349.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Google Picasa. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An integer underflow may occur in the processing of JPEG tags.An integer overflow may occur in the parsing of TIFF tags.A boundary error may occur in the parsing of TIFF tags.A stack overflow may occur in the parsing of RAW files.The original advisory is available at:http://secunia.com/secunia_research/2013-14/Hossein Lotfi, Secunia Research, reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2013-5349.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2013-5357.title: Google Picasa File Parsing Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2013-5357.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Google Picasa. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An integer underflow may occur in the processing of JPEG tags.An integer overflow may occur in the parsing of TIFF tags.A boundary error may occur in the parsing of TIFF tags.A stack overflow may occur in the parsing of RAW files.The original advisory is available at:http://secunia.com/secunia_research/2013-14/Hossein Lotfi, Secunia Research, reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2013-5357.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2013-5358.title: Google Picasa File Parsing Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2013-5358.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Google Picasa. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An integer underflow may occur in the processing of JPEG tags.An integer overflow may occur in the parsing of TIFF tags.A boundary error may occur in the parsing of TIFF tags.A stack overflow may occur in the parsing of RAW files.The original advisory is available at:http://secunia.com/secunia_research/2013-14/Hossein Lotfi, Secunia Research, reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2013-5358.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2013-5359.title: Google Picasa File Parsing Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2013-5359.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Google Picasa. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An integer underflow may occur in the processing of JPEG tags.An integer overflow may occur in the parsing of TIFF tags.A boundary error may occur in the parsing of TIFF tags.A stack overflow may occur in the parsing of RAW files.The original advisory is available at:http://secunia.com/secunia_research/2013-14/Hossein Lotfi, Secunia Research, reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2013-5359.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2013-5452.title: IBM Business Process Manager XML External Entity Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2013-5452.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Business Process Manager. A remote user can conduct XML external entity attacks to obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can supply specially crafted XML External Entity (XXE) data to the target interface to obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system with the privileges of the target service.
CVE-2013-5452.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system with the privileges of the target service.

CVE-2013-5462.title: IBM FileNet Content Manager ACCE Tool Lets Remote Users Conduct Clickjacking Attacks
CVE-2013-5462.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM FileNet Content Manager. A remote user can conduct click-jacking attacks.A remote user can hijack a target user's mouse clicks to take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vulnerability resides in the IBM Content Navigator toolkit component of the included Administration Console for Content Engine (ACCE) tool.
CVE-2013-5462.extra: A remote user can conduct clickjacking attacks.

CVE-2013-5469.title: Cisco IOS TCP ACK Processing Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-5469.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can exploit a flaw in the TCP stack and send a specially crafted sequence of TCP ACK and FIN packets to the target device to cause an ACK storm, consuming excessive network bandwidth and CPU resources.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtz14399 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5469.extra: A remote user can consume excessive network bandwidth and CPU resources.

CVE-2013-5471.title: Cisco Global Site Selector (GSS) Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2013-5471.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Global Site Selector (GSS). A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.The web interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can take actions on the interface acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh42164 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5471.extra: A remote user can take actions on the web interface acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-5483.title: Cisco SocialMiner Input Validation Flaw in 'bookmarklet.jsp' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-5483.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco SocialMiner. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The 'bookmarklet.jsp' page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco SocialMiner software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh73868 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5483.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco SocialMiner software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-5492.title: Cisco SocialMiner 'administration.jsp' Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2013-5492.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco SocialMiner. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.The software uses an insecure HTTP connection between a Cisco SocialMiner client and server when handling the 'administration.jsp' page. A remote user with the ability to monitor HTTP traffic between the client and the server can obtain potentially sensitive information related to the authenticated user of the target system.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh76780 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5492.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2013-5493.title: Cisco Virtualization Experience Client Input Validation Flaw in Diagnostic Module Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2013-5493.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Virtualization Experience Client. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can exploit a flaw in the diagnostic module to execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug68407 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5493.extra: A local user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.

CVE-2013-5494.title: Cisco Unified MeetingPlace Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2013-5494.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified MeetingPlace and Cisco Unified MeetingPlace Web Conferencing. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCui44674 and CSCui45209 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5494.extra: A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-5495.title: Cisco Unified MeetingPlace Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-5495.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified MeetingPlace. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified MeetingPlace software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui44681 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5495.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified MeetingPlace software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-5496.title: Cisco NX-OS ONEP Pointer Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-5496.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted data to an Open Network Environment Platform (ONEP) enabled network element to trigger a pointer validation flaw and cause the target element to reload.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui51551 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5496.extra: A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2013-5497.title: Cisco Intrusion Prevention System Authentication Manager Process Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-5497.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Intrusion Prevention System. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted request to the Cisco IPS management interface to exploit a token handling flaw in the authentication manager process and cause MainApp to hang intermittently.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuf20148 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5497.extra: A remote user can cause the target MainApp process to hang.

CVE-2013-5500.title: Cisco MediaSense Input Validation Flaws in oraadmin Service Page Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-5500.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco MediaSense. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The oraadmin service page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco MediaSense software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuj23320, CSCuj23324, CSCuj23333, CSCuj23338, and CSCuj23328 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5500.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco MediaSense software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui30266 to this vulnerability.

CVE-2013-5505.title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Administration Interface Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-5505.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The Administration Interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Identity Services Engine administration interface software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui30275 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5505.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Identity Services Engine administration interface software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-5516.title: Cisco TelePresence Multipoint Switch Media Snapshot Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-5516.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco TelePresence Multipoint Switch. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted requests for Media Snapshot while the meeting is terminated to cause the target system to reload.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh44796 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5516.extra: A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to reload.

CVE-2013-5523.title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Flaw in Sponsor Portal Permits Cross-Frame Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-5523.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-frame scripting attacks.The Sponsor Portal does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted web frame that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui82666 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5523.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-5524.title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Flaw in Troubleshooting Page Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-5524.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The troubleshooting page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug77655 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5524.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-5525.title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Flaw in Web Framework Lets Remote Authenticated Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2013-5525.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.The web framework does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug90502 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5525.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2013-5567.title: Cisco ASA Inspection and Filtering Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-5567.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a flaw in the inspection and filter functions and cause the target device to reload.A received packet that is matched for both filtering and inspection when a configuration has overlapping traffic matching criteria can trigger this flaw.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui45606 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5567.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

CVE-2013-5610.title: Mozilla Firefox Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-5610.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Some memory corruption errors may occur [CVE-2013-5609, CVE-2013-5610, CVE-2013-5613, CVE-2013-6671].The doorhanger notification for Web App installation may persist from one site to another without being dismissed by the navigation, which may allow a remote user to trick a target user into installing an application from another site [CVE-2013-5611].A web page can inherit character encodings across navigations into another domain from a previously visited site [CVE-2013-5612].Iframe sandbox tag restrictions are not applied to an object element within a sandboxed iframe. A remote user may be able to bypass sandbox restrictions [CVE-2013-5614].A heap-use-after-free may occur in libxul.so!nsEventListenerManager::HandleEventSubType() [CVE-2013-5616].A use-after-free may occur in nsNodeUtils::LastRelease() [CVE-2013-5618].An overflow may occur in the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine [CVE-2013-5619].On Linux-based systems, a script can read clipboard data in certain cases [CVE-2013-6672].The system will trust extended validation root certificates even if the user has explicitly removed their trust [CVE-2013-6673].Unpredictable behavior may occur during JavaScript compilation, as GetElementIC typed array stubs can be generated outside observed typesets [CVE-2013-5615].The Start Of Scan (SOS) and Define Huffman Table (DHT) markers in the libjpeg library are not properly processed. A remote user may be able to read arbitrary memory content [CVE-2013-6629, CVE-2013-6630].The browser includes an invalid subordinate certificate issued by Directorate General of the Treasury (DG Tresor), subordinate to the Government of France CA (ANSSI). Unauthorized digital certificates derived from this certificate authority are being actively used in attacks against various Google domains. The vulnerability is due to the certificate authority and not the browser itself. Ben Turner, Bobby Holley, Jesse Ruderman, Christian Holler, Christoph Diehl, Myk Melez, Masato Kinugawa, Daniel Veditz, Tyson Smith and Jesse Schwartzentruber of the BlackBerry Security Automated Analysis Team, Nils, Dan Gohman, Vincent Lefevre, Sijie Xia, Atte Kettunen from OUSPG, Eric Faust, and Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2013-5610.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with a target site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
