CVE-2013-5619.title: Mozilla Firefox Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-5619.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Some memory corruption errors may occur [CVE-2013-5609, CVE-2013-5610, CVE-2013-5613, CVE-2013-6671].The doorhanger notification for Web App installation may persist from one site to another without being dismissed by the navigation, which may allow a remote user to trick a target user into installing an application from another site [CVE-2013-5611].A web page can inherit character encodings across navigations into another domain from a previously visited site [CVE-2013-5612].Iframe sandbox tag restrictions are not applied to an object element within a sandboxed iframe. A remote user may be able to bypass sandbox restrictions [CVE-2013-5614].A heap-use-after-free may occur in libxul.so!nsEventListenerManager::HandleEventSubType() [CVE-2013-5616].A use-after-free may occur in nsNodeUtils::LastRelease() [CVE-2013-5618].An overflow may occur in the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine [CVE-2013-5619].On Linux-based systems, a script can read clipboard data in certain cases [CVE-2013-6672].The system will trust extended validation root certificates even if the user has explicitly removed their trust [CVE-2013-6673].Unpredictable behavior may occur during JavaScript compilation, as GetElementIC typed array stubs can be generated outside observed typesets [CVE-2013-5615].The Start Of Scan (SOS) and Define Huffman Table (DHT) markers in the libjpeg library are not properly processed. A remote user may be able to read arbitrary memory content [CVE-2013-6629, CVE-2013-6630].The browser includes an invalid subordinate certificate issued by Directorate General of the Treasury (DG Tresor), subordinate to the Government of France CA (ANSSI). Unauthorized digital certificates derived from this certificate authority are being actively used in attacks against various Google domains. The vulnerability is due to the certificate authority and not the browser itself. Ben Turner, Bobby Holley, Jesse Ruderman, Christian Holler, Christoph Diehl, Myk Melez, Masato Kinugawa, Daniel Veditz, Tyson Smith and Jesse Schwartzentruber of the BlackBerry Security Automated Analysis Team, Nils, Dan Gohman, Vincent Lefevre, Sijie Xia, Atte Kettunen from OUSPG, Eric Faust, and Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2013-5619.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with a target site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-5619.title: Mozilla Seamonkey Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-5619.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Seamonkey. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Some memory corruption errors may occur [CVE-2013-5609, CVE-2013-5610, CVE-2013-5613, CVE-2013-6671].A web page can inherit character encodings across navigations into another domain from a previously visited site [CVE-2013-5612].Iframe sandbox tag restrictions are not applied to an object element within a sandboxed iframe. A remote user may be able to bypass sandbox restrictions [CVE-2013-5614].A heap-use-after-free may occur in libxul.so!nsEventListenerManager::HandleEventSubType() [CVE-2013-5616].A use-after-free may occur in nsNodeUtils::LastRelease() [CVE-2013-5618].An overflow may occur in the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine [CVE-2013-5619].On Linux-based systems, a script can read clipboard data in certain cases [CVE-2013-6672].The system will trust extended validation root certificates even if the user has explicitly removed their trust [CVE-2013-6673].Unpredictable behavior may occur during JavaScript compilation, as GetElementIC typed array stubs can be generated outside observed typesets [CVE-2013-5615].The Start Of Scan (SOS) and Define Huffman Table (DHT) markers in the libjpeg library are not properly processed. A remote user may be able to read arbitrary memory content [CVE-2013-6629, CVE-2013-6630].The browser includes an invalid subordinate certificate issued by Directorate General of the Treasury (DG Tresor), subordinate to the Government of France CA (ANSSI). Unauthorized digital certificates derived from this certificate authority are being actively used in attacks against various Google domains. The vulnerability is due to the certificate authority and not the browser itself.Ben Turner, Bobby Holley, Jesse Ruderman, Christian Holler, Christoph Diehl, Myk Melez, Masato Kinugawa, Daniel Veditz, Tyson Smith and Jesse Schwartzentruber of theBlackBerry Security Automated Analysis Team, Nils, Dan Gohman, Vincent Lefevre, Sijie Xia, Atte Kettunen from OUSPG, Eric Faust, and Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2013-5619.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with a target site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-5641.title: Asterisk SIP ACK With SDP Processing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-5641.body: A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a SIP ACK with SDP that is received after the channel has been terminated to cause the target service to crash.The vendor was notified on February 11, 2013.Colin Cuthbertson reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5641.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2013-5642.title: Asterisk SIP Request Processing Flaw With Invalid SDP Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-5642.body: A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP request with an invalid SDP to cause the target service to crash.The vendor was notified on July 03, 2013.Walter Doekes, OSSO B.V., reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5642.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2013-5666.title: FreeBSD Kernel sendfile(2) Discloses Kernel Memory Contents to Local Users
CVE-2013-5666.body: A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD Kernel. A local user can obtain kernel memory contents.A local user can invoke sendfile(2) with a length value that is greater than the length of the file being transmitted to cause the system to pad the packet with contents from kernel memory.Ed Maste reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5666.extra: A local user can obtain kernel memory contents.

CVE-2013-5680.title: HylaFAX+ Heap Overflow May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2013-5680.body: A vulnerability was reported in HylaFAX+. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.On systems where HylaFAX+ is configured for LDAP authentication support, a remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a heap overflow and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target 'hfaxd' service (typically 'uucp' privileges).The vendor was notified on July 22, 2013.Dennis Jenkins reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5680.extra: A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2013-5701.title: WatchGuard Server Center Insecure DLL Loading Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2013-5701.body: A vulnerability was reported in WatchGuard Server Center. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.The software loads the 'wgpr.dll' DLL from an untrusted directory. A local user can place an alternate version containing arbitrary code in the application path to cause the code to be executed with System privileges.The vendor was notified on July 30, 2013.The vendor has assigned bug ID 75251 to this vulnerability.Julien Ahrens from RCE Security reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5701.extra: A local user can obtain System privileges on the target system.

CVE-2013-5710.title: FreeBSD Kernel nullfs(5) Cross-Mount Links May Let Local Users Bypass Access Controls
CVE-2013-5710.body: A vulnerability was reported in FreeBSD. A local user can bypass filesystem access controls in certain cases.A local user with read access to a nullfs view and write access to a different nullfs view into the same filesystem can create a hard link from the read-only view to the other view to be able to gain write access on an ostensibly read-only file system.Konstantin Belousov reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5710.extra: A local user can bypass filesystem access controls in certain cases.

CVE-2013-5723.title: SAP NetWeaver ABAD0_DELETE_DERIVATION_TABLE Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2013-5723.body: A vulnerability was reported in SAP NetWeaver. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.The vendor was notified on January 25, 2013.The original advisory is available at:http://erpscan.com/advisories/dsecrg-13-016-sap-netweaver-abad0_delete_derivation_table/Nikolay Mescherin (ERPScan) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5723.extra: A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2013-5959.title: Blue Coat ProxySG HTTP Request Processing Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-5959.body: A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote server can return specially crafted data to trigger a memory leak and cause the target device to drop or bypass traffic. HTML with a large number of recursively embedded HREF tags can trigger this flaw.A reboot is required to return the system to normal operations.
CVE-2013-5959.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to drop or bypass traffic.

CVE-2013-5968.title: CA SiteMinder Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-5968.body: A vulnerability was reported in CA SiteMinder. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software may not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the CA SiteMinder software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Zachary Pritchard, Cigital, reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5968.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the CA SiteMinder software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-5970.title: VMware ESX/ESXi hostd-vmdb Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-5970.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESX/ESXi. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can modify management traffic to cause denial of service conditions on the hostd-vmdb service.Alex Chapman of Context Information Security reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5970.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2013-5973.title: VMware ESX Server Lets Local Users View and Modify Files
CVE-2013-5973.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESX/ESXi. A local user can view and modify arbitrary files on the target system.A vCenter Server user with the 'Add Existing Disk' privileges can view and modify arbitrary files on ESXi or ESX.A local user on ESX can view and modify arbitrary files.This can be exploited to cause arbitrary code to be executed when the system reboots.
CVE-2013-5973.extra: A local user can view and modify arbitrary files on the target system.

CVE-2013-5975.title: BIG-IP APM Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting and Clickjacking Attacks
CVE-2013-5975.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in BIG-IP APM. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct clickjacking attacks.The access policy logout page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the BIG-IP interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned ID 407603 to this vulnerability.The access policy logon page may allow a remote user to conduct clickjacking attacks.The vulnerability as ID 395751 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5975.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the BIG-IP interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can conduct clickjacking attacks.

CVE-2013-5976.title: BIG-IP APM Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting and Clickjacking Attacks
CVE-2013-5976.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in BIG-IP APM. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct clickjacking attacks.The access policy logout page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the BIG-IP interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned ID 407603 to this vulnerability.The access policy logon page may allow a remote user to conduct clickjacking attacks.The vulnerability as ID 395751 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-5976.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the BIG-IP interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can conduct clickjacking attacks.

CVE-2013-6013.title: Juniper Junos SRX Series Gateway Buffer Overflow in Telnet Firewall Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2013-6013.body: A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos SRX Series Gateway. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted telnet protocol messages to a system configured for telnet pass-through authentication to trigger a buffer overflow in the flow daemon (flowd) and execute arbitrary code on the target system.The vendor has assigned PR 861558 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6013.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2013-6015.title: Juniper Junos SRX Series Gateway TCP Proxy Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-6015.body: A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos SRX Series Gateways. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted, valid TCP packets to cause the target flow daemon (flowd) to crash.SRX Series services gateways are affected.Systems configured with plugins that use TCP proxy are affected.The vendor has assigned PR 791201 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6015.extra: A remote user can cause the target flow daemon to crash.

CVE-2013-6016.title: F5 BIG-IP Traffic Management Microkernel Component Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-6016.body: A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) component to restart. This may temporarily block traffic processing.The vendor has assigned ID 363504 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6016.extra: A remote user can cause the system to temporarily stop processing.

CVE-2013-6025.title: Sybase Adaptive Server XML External Entity Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticate Users View Files
CVE-2013-6025.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sybase Adaptive Server. A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.A remote authenticated user can submit a specially crafted SQL request to trigger an XML External Entity (XXE) process flaw and view files with the privileges of the Adaptive Server process.Igor Bulatenko reported this vulnerability via US-CERT.
CVE-2013-6025.extra: A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.

CVE-2013-6044.title: Django Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6044.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Django. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Django software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The 'URLField' of the administrative interface (django.contrib.admin) is affected.Lukasz Langa reported this vulnerability.The django.utils.http.is_safe_url() function is affected.Nick Bruun reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6044.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Django software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6111.title: mod_pagespeed Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6111.body: A vulnerability was reported in mod_pagespeed. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the mod_pagespeed software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2013-6111.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the mod_pagespeed software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6170.title: Juniper Junos PIM Join Message Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-6170.body: A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user can send a large number of specially crafted IPv4 or IPv6 PIM join messages to cause the target RPD routing daemon to crash.Systems configured for a Next-Generation Multicast VPN (NGEN MVPN) environment are affected.The vendor has assigned PR 669783 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6170.extra: A remote authenticated user can cause the target routing service to crash and restart.

CVE-2013-6173.title: EMC Document Sciences xPression Bugs Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting, Cross-Site Request Forgery, SQL Injection, and Directory Traversal Attacks
CVE-2013-6173.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in EMC Document Sciences xPression. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote user can inject SQL commands. A remote user can view files on the target system.A remote user can exploit a flaw in several administrative actions in xAdmin and xDashboard to cause a target user to take actions on the target site acting as the target user [CVE-2013-6173]. Versions 4.1.x are not affected.Some paramaters in xAdmin allow a remote user to redirect target users to and arbitrary web site [CVE-2013-6174].Several xAdmin and xDashboard forms do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2013-6175]. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the EMC Document Sciences xPression software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated xAdmin or xDashboard user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2013-6176].A remote authenticated xDashboard user can exploit a path traversal flaw to read arbitrary files on the target system [CVE-2013-6177].Sertan Kolat, Omer Coskun, and Thierry Zoller of Verizon Enterprise Solutions - Threat and Vulnerability Management (GCIS).
CVE-2013-6173.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the EMC Document Sciences xPression software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.A remote user can view files on the target system.

CVE-2013-6178.title: RSA Archer eGRC Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6178.body: A vulnerability was reported in RSA Archer eGRC. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Several components do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the RSA Archer eGRC software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2013-6178.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the RSA Archer eGRC software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6180.title: RSA Security Analytics Core Can Be Accessed By Remote Users
CVE-2013-6180.body: A vulnerability was reported in RSA Security Analytics. A remote user can access the Security Analytics core.The system allows a remote user specifying a known untrusted User Agent value can access the Security Analytics (SA) core.RSA NetWitness NextGen version 9.8 is also affected.
CVE-2013-6180.extra: A remote user can access the Security Analytics core.

CVE-2013-6181.title: EMC Watch4net Lets Local Users Obtain Device Passwords
CVE-2013-6181.body: A vulnerability was reported in EMC Watch4net. A local user can view passwords.The system stores passwords of monitored devices in clear text in its installation repository. A local user with access to the installation repository can view the passwords.
CVE-2013-6181.extra: A local user with access to the installation repository can view the passwords.

CVE-2013-6191.title: HP Operations Orchestration Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting and Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2013-6191.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in HP Operations Orchestration. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the HP Operations Orchestration software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has SSRT101342 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6191.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the HP Operations Orchestration software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6192.title: HP Operations Orchestration Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting and Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2013-6192.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in HP Operations Orchestration. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the HP Operations Orchestration software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has SSRT101342 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6192.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the HP Operations Orchestration software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6196.title: HP Autonomy Ultraseek Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6196.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP Autonomy Ultraseek. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the HP Autonomy Ultraseek software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned SSRT101354 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6196.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the HP Autonomy Ultraseek software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6198.title: HP Service Manager Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6198.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP Service Manager. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote authenticated user on the adjacent network can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2013-6197].The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2013-6198]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the HP Service Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID SSRT101405 to this vulnerability.Both WebTier and Windows Client are affected.
CVE-2013-6198.extra: A remote authenticated user on the adjacent network can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the HP Service Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6202.title: HP Service Manager Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Deny Service and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting and Cross-Site Requset Forgery Attacks
CVE-2013-6202.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in HP Service Manager. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can cause partial denial of service conditions.A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the HP Service Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can obtain unauthorized access.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
CVE-2013-6202.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the HP Service Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2013-6220.title: HP Network Node Manager I (NNMi) Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6220.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP Network Node Manager I (NNMi). A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the HP Network Node Manager I (NNMi) software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned SSRT101479 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6220.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the HP Network Node Manager I (NNMi) software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6221.title: HP Service Virtualization Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2013-6221.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP Service Virtualization. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code on the target system.Systems running AutoPass License Server are affected.The vendor has assigned SSRT101385 to this vulnerability.Andrea Micalizzi, aka rgod, reported this vulnerability (via HP's Zero Day Initiative).
CVE-2013-6221.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2013-6222.title: HP Service Manager Bugs Let Remote Users Gain Elevated Privileges, Modify Data, and Deny Service and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting and Cross-Site Requset Forgery Attacks
CVE-2013-6222.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in HP Service Manager. A remote user can gain full control of the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote user can modify data and cause denial of service conditions.The Mobility Web Client and Service Request Catalog do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2013-6222]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the HP Service Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can exploit flaws in the WebTier to gain elevated privileges and take full control of the target system [CVE-2014-2632].A remote user can exploit flaws in the Service Manager Server to take actions on the target site acting as the target user [CVE-2014-2633].A remote user can gain unauthorized access on the Service Manager Server to modify data and cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2014-2634].
CVE-2013-6222.extra: A remote user can gain full control of the target system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the HP Service Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can modify information or cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2013-6242.title: Open-Xchange Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6242.body: A vulnerability was reported in Open-Xchange. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Several components do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can send a specially crafted email that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Open-Xchange software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The TITLE tag is affected in versions 6.22.4 and prior.The META tag is affected.The URL parameter is affected.The vendor was notified on October 22, 2013 and November 5, 2013.
CVE-2013-6242.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Open-Xchange software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6267.title: Claroline Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6267.body: A vulnerability was reported in Claroline. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Claroline software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The 'box' parameter in '/claroline/messaging/messagebox.php' is affected.The 'cidToEdit' parameter in '/claroline/admin/adminregisteruser.php' is affected.The 'cidToEdit' parameter in '/claroline/admin/admin_user_course_settings.php' is affected.The 'module_id' parameter in '/claroline/admin/module/module.php' is affected.The 'offset' parameter in '/claroline/admin/right/profile_list.php' is affected.The vendor was notified on October 23, 2013.High-Tech Bridge Security Research Lab reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6267.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Claroline software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6271.title: Google Android 'com.android.settings' Lets Local Applications Remote Device Locks
CVE-2013-6271.body: A vulnerability was reported in Google Android. A local user (application) can remove device locks on the target system.An application can remove all existing device locks activated by a user without having permission to remove the locks.The vendor was notified on October 11, 2013.The original advisory is available at:https://cureblog.de/2013/11/cve-2013-6271-remove-device-locks-from-android-phone/Curesec Research Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6271.extra: A local user (application) can remove device locks on the target system.

CVE-2013-6275.title: Horde Groupware Functions Permit Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2013-6275.body: A vulnerability was reported in Horde Groupware. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.Several functions do not properly validate user input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Horde Groupware software and will be able to take actions on the site acting as the target user.The creating a rule, updating, enabling, and deleting functions are affected.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/29274/Marcela Benetrix reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6275.extra: A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6348.title: Apache Struts 'namespace' Parameter Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6348.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apache Struts. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Struts software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.http://[target]:8080/struts2-07/config-browser/actionNames.action?namespace=<script>alert(/xss/);</script>http://[target]:8080/struts2-07/config-browser/showConfig.action?namespace=<script>alert(/xss/);</script>&actionName=showcaseThe 'showcase' demonstration application is affected. Other applications may also be affected.The original advisory is available at:http://en.wooyun.org/bugs/wooyun-2013-034Nebula@Wooyun reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6348.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Struts software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6375.title: Xen TLB Flushing Error Lets Local Users on the Guest Operating System Deny Service or Gain Elevated Privileges on the Host System
CVE-2013-6375.body: A vulnerability was reported in Xen. A local user on the guest operating system can cause denial of service conditions on the target host system. A local user on the guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target host system.A local administrative user on the guest operating system can supply a specially crafted parameter value to trigger a Translation Lookaside Buffer (TLB) flushing error and access restricted memory.This can be exploited to cause denial of service conditions on the host system or gain privileges on the host system.Systems using Intel VT-d for PCI passthrough are affected.
CVE-2013-6375.extra: A local user on the guest operating system can cause denial of service conditions on the target host system.A local user on the guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target host system.

CVE-2013-6398.title: Citrix CloudPlatform Virtual Router Firewall Bug Lets Remote Users Access Network Resources
CVE-2013-6398.body: A vulnerability was reported in Citrix CloudPlatform Virtual Router. A remote user can bypass access controls to access network resources.Source restrictions in the firewall rules are not properly saved when a virtual router is stopped and restarted.The Cloud team at Schuberg Philis reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6398.extra: A remote user can bypass access controls to access network resources.

CVE-2013-6400.title: Xen IOMMU TLB Flush Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2013-6400.body: A vulnerability was reported in Xen. A local guest user may be able to access host memory.The system does not properly flush IOMMU TLB buffer memory. A local administrative user on the guest operating system may be able to access memory on the host system, cause denial of service conditions on the host system, or gain privileges on the host system.Only guests that have been assigned PCI devices are affected.Only systems using Intel VT-d are affected.Jan Beulich reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6400.extra: A local administrative user on the guest operating system may be able to access memory on the host system, cause denial of service conditions on the host system, or gain privileges on the host system.

CVE-2013-6420.title: PHP OpenSSL Memory Corruption Flaw in openssl_x509_parse() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2013-6420.body: A vulnerability was reported in PHP. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted certificate to trigger a memory corruption flaw in openssl_x509_parse() and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target PHP application.Stefan Esser reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6420.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2013-6434.title: Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager Insecure SPICE Connection Lets Remote Users Conduct Man-in-the-Middle Attacks
CVE-2013-6434.body: A vulnerability was reported in Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager. A remote user can conduct man-in-the-middle attacks.The system allows an insecure SPICE connection, which is susceptible to man-in-the-middle attacks.Michael Samuel of Amcom reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6434.extra: A remote user can conduct man-in-the-middle attacks.

CVE-2013-6443.title: Red Hat CloudForms Management Engine Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2013-6443.body: A vulnerability was reported in Red Hat CloudForms. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.The Management Engine does not properly validate GET request for destructive actions, allowing the request to bypass the Ruby on Rails protect_from_forgery mechanism. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks to take actions on the target site acting as the target user.Martin Povolny of Red Hat reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6443.extra: A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6445.title: Red Hat Enterprise MRG Messaging Management Console Password Hashing Method Lets Local Users Recover Passwords
CVE-2013-6445.body: A vulnerability was reported in Red Hat Enterprise MRG Messaging. A local user can determine passwords.The MRG Management Console (cumin) uses the DES-based crypt(3) hash function to protet passwords. A local user can conduct brute-force password guessing attacks to recover plain text passwords.Tomas Novacik of the Red Hat MRG Quality Engineering team.
CVE-2013-6445.extra: A local user can obtain obtain passwords on the target system.

CVE-2013-6447.title: JBoss Web Framework Kit Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2013-6447.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in JBoss Web Framework Kit. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can supply a specially crafted XML file to the ExecutionHandler, PollHandler, or SubscriptionHandler JBoss Seam Remoting classes to view files on the target system [CVE-2013-6447].A remote user can access the InterfaceGenerator handler in JBoss Seam Remoting to obtain information on all classes and methods on the target server's classpath [CVE-2013-6448].Jon Passki of Coverity SRL reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2013-6447.extra: A remote user can view files on the target system.A remote user can obtain information on all classes and methods on the target system.

CVE-2013-6448.title: JBoss Web Framework Kit Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2013-6448.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in JBoss Web Framework Kit. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can supply a specially crafted XML file to the ExecutionHandler, PollHandler, or SubscriptionHandler JBoss Seam Remoting classes to view files on the target system [CVE-2013-6447].A remote user can access the InterfaceGenerator handler in JBoss Seam Remoting to obtain information on all classes and methods on the target server's classpath [CVE-2013-6448].Jon Passki of Coverity SRL reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2013-6448.extra: A remote user can view files on the target system.A remote user can obtain information on all classes and methods on the target system.

CVE-2013-6449.title: OpenSSL Incorrect Version Number Used in ssl_get_algorithm2() Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-6449.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.The ssl_get_algorithm2() function in 'ssl/s3_lib.c' uses an incorrect version number. A remote user can send specially crafted data (using TLS 1.2) to cause the target service to crash.Ron Barber reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6449.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2013-6450.title: OpenSSL DTLS Retransmission Error May Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-6450.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.The DTLS retransmission implementation does not properly maintain data structures for digest and encryption contexts. A remote user conducting a man-in-the-middle attack or a remote server may be able to trigger the use of a different context and cause the target client to crash.Dmitry Sobinov reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6450.extra: A remote user may be able to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks to deny service.

CVE-2013-6450.title: Sun Integrated Lights-Out Manager Bugs Let Remote Authenticated Users Partially Access Data, Modify Data, and Deny Service
CVE-2013-6450.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Sun Integrated Lights-Out Manager. A remote authenticated user can cause partial denial of service conditions. A remote authenticated user can partially access and modify data.A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the Integrated Lights Out Manager (ILOM) IPMI component to partially access data, partially modify data, and deny service [CVE-2015-0424].A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the ILOM Backup Restore component to partially access data [CVE-2014-6584].A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the ILOM OpenSSL component to partially access and partially modify data [CVE-2014-0224].A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the ILOM OpenSSL component to cause partial denial of service conditions [CVE-2013-6450].The following researchers reported these and other Oracle vulnerabilities:Abdullah Erdem; Adam Willard of Foreground Security; Amir Sohail; Arjun V; Avik Sarkar; Ayoub Nait Lamine; Ben Khlifa Fahmi; Cameron Crowley; Christian Galeone; Gaurav Mishra; Gopal Bisht; Gurjant Singh Sadhra; Karthik E C; Koutrouss Naddara; M.Asim Shahzad; Mohammed Osman; Monendra Sahu; Mousab Elhag; Muhammad Sarmad Shafiq; Rakesh Singh of Zero Day Guys; Sandeep Venkatesan; Sky_BlaCk; Sreehari; Srikanth Y; and Yann CAM.
CVE-2013-6450.extra: A remote authenticated user can cause partial denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user can partially access and modify data.

CVE-2013-6618.title: Juniper Junos J-Web '/jsdm/ajax/port.php' Script Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
CVE-2013-6618.body: A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.A remote authenticated user with low privileges can send specially crafted data to '/jsdm/ajax/port.php' to execute arbitrary commands or hijack user sessions.The vendor was notified on September 27, 2012.The original advisory is available at:http://www.senseofsecurity.com.au/advisories/SOS-13-003Phil from Sense of Security Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6618.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.

CVE-2013-6629.title: Mozilla Seamonkey Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6629.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Seamonkey. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Some memory corruption errors may occur [CVE-2013-5609, CVE-2013-5610, CVE-2013-5613, CVE-2013-6671].A web page can inherit character encodings across navigations into another domain from a previously visited site [CVE-2013-5612].Iframe sandbox tag restrictions are not applied to an object element within a sandboxed iframe. A remote user may be able to bypass sandbox restrictions [CVE-2013-5614].A heap-use-after-free may occur in libxul.so!nsEventListenerManager::HandleEventSubType() [CVE-2013-5616].A use-after-free may occur in nsNodeUtils::LastRelease() [CVE-2013-5618].An overflow may occur in the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine [CVE-2013-5619].On Linux-based systems, a script can read clipboard data in certain cases [CVE-2013-6672].The system will trust extended validation root certificates even if the user has explicitly removed their trust [CVE-2013-6673].Unpredictable behavior may occur during JavaScript compilation, as GetElementIC typed array stubs can be generated outside observed typesets [CVE-2013-5615].The Start Of Scan (SOS) and Define Huffman Table (DHT) markers in the libjpeg library are not properly processed. A remote user may be able to read arbitrary memory content [CVE-2013-6629, CVE-2013-6630].The browser includes an invalid subordinate certificate issued by Directorate General of the Treasury (DG Tresor), subordinate to the Government of France CA (ANSSI). Unauthorized digital certificates derived from this certificate authority are being actively used in attacks against various Google domains. The vulnerability is due to the certificate authority and not the browser itself.Ben Turner, Bobby Holley, Jesse Ruderman, Christian Holler, Christoph Diehl, Myk Melez, Masato Kinugawa, Daniel Veditz, Tyson Smith and Jesse Schwartzentruber of theBlackBerry Security Automated Analysis Team, Nils, Dan Gohman, Vincent Lefevre, Sijie Xia, Atte Kettunen from OUSPG, Eric Faust, and Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2013-6629.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with a target site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6629.title: Mozilla Firefox Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6629.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Some memory corruption errors may occur [CVE-2013-5609, CVE-2013-5610, CVE-2013-5613, CVE-2013-6671].The doorhanger notification for Web App installation may persist from one site to another without being dismissed by the navigation, which may allow a remote user to trick a target user into installing an application from another site [CVE-2013-5611].A web page can inherit character encodings across navigations into another domain from a previously visited site [CVE-2013-5612].Iframe sandbox tag restrictions are not applied to an object element within a sandboxed iframe. A remote user may be able to bypass sandbox restrictions [CVE-2013-5614].A heap-use-after-free may occur in libxul.so!nsEventListenerManager::HandleEventSubType() [CVE-2013-5616].A use-after-free may occur in nsNodeUtils::LastRelease() [CVE-2013-5618].An overflow may occur in the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine [CVE-2013-5619].On Linux-based systems, a script can read clipboard data in certain cases [CVE-2013-6672].The system will trust extended validation root certificates even if the user has explicitly removed their trust [CVE-2013-6673].Unpredictable behavior may occur during JavaScript compilation, as GetElementIC typed array stubs can be generated outside observed typesets [CVE-2013-5615].The Start Of Scan (SOS) and Define Huffman Table (DHT) markers in the libjpeg library are not properly processed. A remote user may be able to read arbitrary memory content [CVE-2013-6629, CVE-2013-6630].The browser includes an invalid subordinate certificate issued by Directorate General of the Treasury (DG Tresor), subordinate to the Government of France CA (ANSSI). Unauthorized digital certificates derived from this certificate authority are being actively used in attacks against various Google domains. The vulnerability is due to the certificate authority and not the browser itself. CVE-2013-6634.title: Google Chrome Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Conduct Session Fixation Attacks, and Spoof the Address Bar
CVE-2013-6634.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Google Chrome. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct session fixation attacks. A remote user can spoof address bar URLs.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can conduct session fixation attacks in sync via 302 redirects [CVE-2013-6634]. Andrey Labunets reported this vulnerability.A user-after-free may occur in editing [CVE-2013-6635]. cloudfuzzer reported this vulnerability.A remote user can exploit flaws in modal dialogs to spoof address bar URLs [CVE-2013-6636]. Bas Venis reported this vulnerability.A buffer overflow may occur [CVE-2013-6638]. Jakob Kummerow of the Chromium project reported this vulnerability.An out-of-bounds memory write may occur [CVE-2013-6639]. Jakob Kummerow of the Chromium project reported this vulnerability.An out-of-bounds memory read may occur [CVE-2013-6640]. Jakob Kummerow of the Chromium project reported this vulnerability.Other flaws may occur [CVE-2013-6637].
CVE-2013-6634.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can conduct session fixation attacks.A remote user can spoof address bar URLs.

CVE-2013-6671.title: Mozilla Firefox Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6671.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Some memory corruption errors may occur [CVE-2013-5609, CVE-2013-5610, CVE-2013-5613, CVE-2013-6671].The doorhanger notification for Web App installation may persist from one site to another without being dismissed by the navigation, which may allow a remote user to trick a target user into installing an application from another site [CVE-2013-5611].A web page can inherit character encodings across navigations into another domain from a previously visited site [CVE-2013-5612].Iframe sandbox tag restrictions are not applied to an object element within a sandboxed iframe. A remote user may be able to bypass sandbox restrictions [CVE-2013-5614].A heap-use-after-free may occur in libxul.so!nsEventListenerManager::HandleEventSubType() [CVE-2013-5616].A use-after-free may occur in nsNodeUtils::LastRelease() [CVE-2013-5618].An overflow may occur in the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine [CVE-2013-5619].On Linux-based systems, a script can read clipboard data in certain cases [CVE-2013-6672].The system will trust extended validation root certificates even if the user has explicitly removed their trust [CVE-2013-6673].Unpredictable behavior may occur during JavaScript compilation, as GetElementIC typed array stubs can be generated outside observed typesets [CVE-2013-5615].The Start Of Scan (SOS) and Define Huffman Table (DHT) markers in the libjpeg library are not properly processed. A remote user may be able to read arbitrary memory content [CVE-2013-6629, CVE-2013-6630].The browser includes an invalid subordinate certificate issued by Directorate General of the Treasury (DG Tresor), subordinate to the Government of France CA (ANSSI). Unauthorized digital certificates derived from this certificate authority are being actively used in attacks against various Google domains.
