Ben Turner, Bobby Holley, Jesse Ruderman, Christian Holler, Christoph Diehl, Myk Melez, Masato Kinugawa, Daniel Veditz, Tyson Smith and Jesse Schwartzentruber of the BlackBerry Security Automated Analysis Team, Nils, Dan Gohman, Vincent Lefevre, Sijie Xia, Atte Kettunen from OUSPG, Eric Faust, and Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2013-6673.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with a target site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6673.title: Mozilla Seamonkey Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6673.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Seamonkey. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Some memory corruption errors may occur [CVE-2013-5609, CVE-2013-5610, CVE-2013-5613, CVE-2013-6671].A web page can inherit character encodings across navigations into another domain from a previously visited site [CVE-2013-5612].Iframe sandbox tag restrictions are not applied to an object element within a sandboxed iframe. A remote user may be able to bypass sandbox restrictions [CVE-2013-5614].A heap-use-after-free may occur in libxul.so!nsEventListenerManager::HandleEventSubType() [CVE-2013-5616].A use-after-free may occur in nsNodeUtils::LastRelease() [CVE-2013-5618].An overflow may occur in the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine [CVE-2013-5619].On Linux-based systems, a script can read clipboard data in certain cases [CVE-2013-6672].The system will trust extended validation root certificates even if the user has explicitly removed their trust [CVE-2013-6673].Unpredictable behavior may occur during JavaScript compilation, as GetElementIC typed array stubs can be generated outside observed typesets [CVE-2013-5615].The Start Of Scan (SOS) and Define Huffman Table (DHT) markers in the libjpeg library are not properly processed. A remote user may be able to read arbitrary memory content [CVE-2013-6629, CVE-2013-6630].The browser includes an invalid subordinate certificate issued by Directorate General of the Treasury (DG Tresor), subordinate to the Government of France CA (ANSSI). Unauthorized digital certificates derived from this certificate authority are being actively used in attacks against various Google domains. The vulnerability is due to the certificate authority and not the browser itself.Ben Turner, Bobby Holley, Jesse Ruderman, Christian Holler, Christoph Diehl, Myk Melez, Masato Kinugawa, Daniel Veditz, Tyson Smith and Jesse Schwartzentruber of theBlackBerry Security Automated Analysis Team, Nils, Dan Gohman, Vincent Lefevre, Sijie Xia, Atte Kettunen from OUSPG, Eric Faust, and Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2013-6673.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with a target site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6674.title: Mozilla Seamonkey Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6674.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Seamonkey. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create a specially crafted email message containing an iframe with a 'data:' URL that, when replied to or forwarded by a target user quoting it "in-line" and using the HTML editor, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2013-6674]. The code will run in the security context of the mail composition window. Fabian Cuchietti reported this vulnerability.The Object and Embed tags are affected [CVE-2014-2018]. Ateeq ur Rehman Khan of Vulnerability Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6674.extra: A remote user can access the target user's email message.

CVE-2013-6674.title: Mozilla Thunderbird Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6674.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Thunderbird. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create a specially crafted email message containing an iframe with a 'data:' URL that, when replied to by a target user quoting it "in-line" and using the HTML editor, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2013-6674]. The code will run in the security context of the mail composition window. Fabian Cuchietti reported this vulnerability.The Object and Embed tags are affected [CVE-2014-2018]. Ateeq ur Rehman Khan of Vulnerability Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6674.extra: A remote user can access the target user's email message.

CVE-2013-6690.title: Cisco Prime Collaboration Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6690.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime Collaboration. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The Assurance component does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Prime Collaboration software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCui92643, CSCui94038, and CSCui94161 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6690.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Prime Collaboration software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6691.title: Cisco ASA WebVPN CIFS Boundary Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-6691.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user can exploit a bounds checking flaw in the WebVPN Common Internet File System (CIFS) access function to cause the target device to reload.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj83344 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6691.extra: A remote authenticated user can cause the target device to reload.

CVE-2013-6701.title: Cisco ONS 15454 TNC Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-6701.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ONS 15454 TNC. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send high levels of traffic to the target Cisco ONS 15454 Transport Node Controller (TNC) to cause a process to fail to receive health pings and cause the TNC to reload.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCud97155 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6701.extra: A remote user can cause the target TNC to reload.

CVE-2013-6702.title: Cisco ONS 15454 Controller Cards Can Be Reset By Remote Users
CVE-2013-6702.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ONS 15454. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted packets to the target control card to trigger an unspecified flaw in the management functions and cause the control card to reset.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtz50902 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6702.extra: A remote user can cause the target control card to reset.

CVE-2013-6703.title: Cisco ONS 15454 Controller Card TLS/SSL Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-6703.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ONS 15454. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted packets to trigger a flaw in the TLS/SSLv3 module and cause the target control card to reset.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh34787 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6703.extra: A remote user can cause the target control card to reset.

CVE-2013-6704.title: Cisco IOS XE TFTP Memory Management Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-6704.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.The system does not properly release memory for flows generated by TFTP UDP traffic. A remote user can make TFTP requests to cause the flow manager to hold UDP sessions in the session table, consuming available memory.A local user can also trigger this flaw.The vendor has assigned Bug IDs CSCuh09324 and CSCty42686 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6704.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to become unstable on crash.

CVE-2013-6705.title: Cisco IOS and IOS XE IPDT Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-6705.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user on the adjacent network can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user on the adjacent network can send specially crafted ARP packets to the target device to trigger a flaw in the IP Device Tracking (IPDT) function and cause the target device to reload.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh38133 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6705.extra: A remote user on the adjacent network can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2013-6706.title: Cisco IOS XE MPLS Processing Flaw Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-6706.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) packets via IP through and out of the target device to cause the target device to reload.Systems configured for MPLS and with certain additional features configured are affected.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj23992 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6706.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

CVE-2013-6707.title: Cisco ASA Memory Leak in Connection Manager Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-6707.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted management session requests to trigger a memory leak in the connection manager code when management flows are created to cause the target system to become unresponsive to management session requests via SSH, Telnet, HTTP, and HTTPS.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug33233 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6707.extra: A remote user can cause the system to become unresponsive to management session requests via SSH, Telnet, HTTP, and HTTPS.

CVE-2013-6708.title: Cisco Cloud Portal Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Users Download Restricted Files
CVE-2013-6708.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Cloud Portal. A remote user can download files from the target system.The system does not properly enforce access controls on certain file types. A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to download files from the target system.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuj08426 and CSCui60889 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6708.extra: A remote user can download files from the target system.

CVE-2013-6709.title: Cisco WebEx Training Center Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting and Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks and Obtain Sensitive Information
CVE-2013-6709.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco WebEx Training Center. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote user can obtain sensitive information. A remote user can access sessions.A remote user can send a specially crafted URL to obtain the registration ID of other users [CVE-2013-6973]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul57121 to this vulnerability.A remote user can view the session number for trainings that require host approval before the host approves the attacker as an attendee [CVE-2013-6972]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul57126 to this vulnerability.A remote user can cause the target user to be redirected to an arbitrary URL [CVE-2013-6971]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul57140 to this vulnerability.A remote user can view registration error messages to determine if the target email address has already been specified by another registered attendee [CVE-2013-6968]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul36003 to this vulnerability.A remote user can cause the target user to be redirected to an arbitrary URL [CVE-2013-6966]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul36031 to this vulnerability.The system discloses the training session information URL prior to confirmation. A remote user can attend the audio conference for a training session without having to confirm the email address [CVE-2013-6965]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul36183 to this vulnerability.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2013-6963]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the WebEx Training Center interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul36207 to this vulnerability.The system discloses the training session information URL prior to confirmation. A remote user can obtain the training session access code and password and join the audio conference [CVE-2013-6709]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul57111 to this vulnerability.The web framework does not properly validate user-supplied requests. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks to take actions as the target user [CVE-2013-6710]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul25567 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6709.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the WebEx Training Center interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can obtain sensitive information.A remote user can access sessions.

CVE-2013-6710.title: Cisco WebEx Training Center Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting and Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks and Obtain Sensitive Information
CVE-2013-6710.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco WebEx Training Center. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote user can obtain sensitive information. A remote user can access sessions.A remote user can send a specially crafted URL to obtain the registration ID of other users [CVE-2013-6973]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul57121 to this vulnerability.A remote user can view the session number for trainings that require host approval before the host approves the attacker as an attendee [CVE-2013-6972]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul57126 to this vulnerability.A remote user can cause the target user to be redirected to an arbitrary URL [CVE-2013-6971]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul57140 to this vulnerability.A remote user can view registration error messages to determine if the target email address has already been specified by another registered attendee [CVE-2013-6968]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul36003 to this vulnerability.A remote user can cause the target user to be redirected to an arbitrary URL [CVE-2013-6966]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul36031 to this vulnerability.The system discloses the training session information URL prior to confirmation. A remote user can attend the audio conference for a training session without having to confirm the email address [CVE-2013-6965]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul36183 to this vulnerability.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2013-6963]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the WebEx Training Center interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul36207 to this vulnerability.The system discloses the training session information URL prior to confirmation. A remote user can obtain the training session access code and password and join the audio conference [CVE-2013-6709]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul57111 to this vulnerability.The web framework does not properly validate user-supplied requests. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks to take actions as the target user [CVE-2013-6710]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul25567 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6710.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the WebEx Training Center interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can obtain sensitive information.A remote user can access sessions.

CVE-2013-6711.title: Cisco WebEx Sales Center Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting and URL Redirect Attacks
CVE-2013-6711.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco WebEx Sales Center. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary URL.The system does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2013-6711]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco WebEx Sales Center interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul25540 to this vulnerability.A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary URL [CVE-2013-6967]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul36020 to this vulnerability.A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary URL [CVE-2013-6959]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul25557 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6711.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco WebEx Sales Center interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary URL.

CVE-2013-6721.title: IBM WebSphere Service Registry and Repository Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6721.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM WebSphere Service Registry and Repository. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The WebSphere Service Registry and Repository (WSRR) Widgets do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target authenticated user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the IBM WebSphere software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2013-6721.extra: A remote user can access the target authenticated user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the IBM WebSphere software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6735.title: IBM WebSphere Portal XPath Injection Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Information
CVE-2013-6735.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM WebSphere Portal. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can supply specially crafted data to obtain configuration data from the target system.The vendor was notified on December 4, 2013.A.Antukh and S.Temnikov, SEC Consult Vulnerability Lab, reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6735.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive configuration information.

CVE-2013-6747.title: IBM Tivoli Directory Server GSKit Certificate Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-6747.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Tivoli Directory Server. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a certificate with a specially crafted X.509 certificate chain to cause the target service to hang or crash.
CVE-2013-6747.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to hang or crash.

CVE-2013-6780.title: cPanel Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6780.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in cPanel. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote authenticated reseller with ACL permission to install SSL certificates can install SSL virtualhosts on arbitrary IPs that do not belong to the reseller. The vendor has assigned case 60890 to this vulnerability. Version 11.36.x is affected.A remote authenticated cPanel, WHM, or Webmail users can exploit a flaw in the Locale::Maketext module and submit a specially crafted translation to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges. The vendor has assigned case 63541 to this vulnerability.The wwwcount component installs the '/usr/local/cpanel/share/Counter' directory with world-writable permissions. A local user can exploit this to cause cPanel to execute arbitrary code in certain cases. The vendor has assigned case 69517 to this vulnerability.A remote authenticated reseller can exploit a flaw in the sprite generation code for the branding subsystem to change permissions of arbitrary files on the target system. The vendor has assigned case 71125 to this vulnerability. Version 11.38.x is affected.When multiple security token failures occur, the system does not invalidate session credentials. A remote user can make cross-site request forgery attacks. The vendor has assigned case 73125 to this vulnerability.The system may disclose security tokens to remote users. The vendor has assigned case 73193 to this vulnerability.When a reseller override login occurs, the session cookie is disclosed via the HTTP_COOKIE environment variable. A local user can obtain the session cookie. The vendor has assigned case 74333 to this vulnerability. Versions 11.36.x. and 11.38.x are affected.The WHM Daily Process Log screen does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A local user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the cPanel software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user. The vendor has assigned case 78045 to this vulnerability.When a root or reseller account performs an upgrade of a cPanel account's cPAddons Site Software installations directly from WHM, the system discloses the REMOTE_PASSWORD environmental variable when the 'cgihidepass' TweakSetting is disabled. The vendor has assigned case 78089 to this vulnerability.A remote authenticated reseller with 'edit-dns' ACL permissions can exploit a flaw in the WHM Edit DNS Zone interface to read portions of root-owned files. The vendor has assigned case 79277 to this vulnerability. Rack911 reported this vulnerability.A remote user can use specially crafted usernames during SSH authentication to exploit a flaw in cPHulk and block or unblock arbitrary IP addresses and accounts from connecting to cPHulk-managed services on the target system. The vendor has assigned case 80113 to this vulnerability. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability.A remote authenticated user can exploit a path traversal flaw in X3 countedit.cgi to write arbitrary files on the target system. The vendor has assigned case 80633 to this vulnerability.The Bandmin passwd file is created with world-readable permissions. A local user can view the username and hashed password required to access Bandmin's stored log data. The vendor has assigned case 81373 to this vulnerability.The the Bandmin bandwidth log viewer does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the cPanel software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user. The vendor has assigned case 81377 to this vulnerability.A remote authenticated Webmail virtual account user can supply a specially crafted HTTP URL to exploit a URL filtering flaw and access phpMyAdmin and phpPgAdmin. The vendor has assigned case 81429 to this vulnerability.A remote authenticated user with a restricted cPanel account can exploit a path traversal flaw in the UI::dynamicincludelist and UI::includelist API calls to read arbitrary files or execute arbitrary code. The vendor has assigned case 81641 to this vulnerability.The Manage Redirection functionality for Addon Domains and Subdomains and the GnuPG Keys interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the cPanel software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user. The vendor has assigned case 81885 to this vulnerability.The system stores Logaholic session files in the world-writable '/tmp' directory. A local user can exploit this to cause cPanel to execute arbitrary code. The vendor has assigned case 82309 to this vulnerability. Rack911 reported this vulnerability.A remote user can exploit a cross-site scripting flaw in the YUI component [CVE-2013-6780]. The vendor has assigned case 82725 to this vulnerability. @soiaxx reported this vulnerability.Database grant files are store with world-readable permissions. The vendor has assigned case 82733 to this vulnerability. Versions 11.38.x and 11.40.x are affected. Rack911 reported this vulnerability.A remote authenticated reseller can exploit a flaw in the goto_uri parameter to conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. The vendor has assigned case 83929 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6780.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the cPanel software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2013-6791.title: Microsoft Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit Lets Users Bypass ASLR Protections
CVE-2013-6791.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit. A user can bypass security controls.The EMET toolkit uses predictable addresses for hooked functions. A user can use return-oriented programming attacks to bypass ASLR protections.The vendor was notified on April 19, 2013.The original advisory is available at:http://en.nsfocus.com/advisories/1301.htmlYu Yang of NSFOCUS Security Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6791.extra: A user can bypass ASLR protections.

CVE-2013-6810.title: EMC Connectrix Manager Converged Network Edition Servlet Bugs Let Remote Users View and Upload Files and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2013-6810.body: A vulnerability was reported in EMC Connectrix Manager Converged Network Edition. A remote user can view files on the target system. A remote user can upload files to the target system. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can download files from the target EMC Connectrix Manager Converged Network Edition (CMCNE) system.A remote user can upload arbitrary files to the target CMCNE system and then cause those files to be executed on the target system.Andrea Micalizzi, aka rgod, reported this vulnerability (via HP's Zero Day Initiative).
CVE-2013-6810.extra: A remote user can view files on the target system.A remote user can upload files to the target system.A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2013-6869.title: SAP NetWeaver Input Validation Flaw in SRTT_GET_COUNT_BEFORE_KEY_RFC Function Lets Remote Authenticated Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2013-6869.body: A vulnerability was reported in SAP NetWeaver. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.The SRTT_GET_COUNT_BEFORE_KEY_RFC function does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.The original advisory is available at:http://erpscan.com/advisories/erpscan-13-017-sap-netweaver-srtt_get_count_before_key_rfc-sql-injection/Nikolay Mescherin (ERPScan) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6869.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2013-6870.title: Splunk Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6870.body: A vulnerability was reported in Splunk. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The system does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Splunk software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.UT Austin Information Security Office reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6870.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Splunk software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6885.title: Xen AMD CPU Bug May Let Local Guest Users Deny Service on the Host System
CVE-2013-6885.body: A vulnerability was reported in Xen. A local user on the guest operating system can cause denial of service conditions on the target host operating system.A local administrative user on the guest operating system can trigger a flaw in AMD-based CPUs to cause a CPU core to hang and the target host system to crash.The underlying vulnerability is described in AMD CPU erratum 793 ("Specific Combination of Writes to Write Combined Memory Types and Locked Instructions May Cause Core Hang").Xen versions 3.3 and later running on family 16h model 00h-0fh AMD CPUs are affected.Jan Beulich reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6885.extra: A local user on the guest operating system can cause the target host operating system to crash.

CVE-2013-6956.title: Juniper Junos Pulse Secure Access Service (SSL VPN) Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6956.body: A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos Pulse Secure Access Service (SSL VPN). A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The SSL VPN web server does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the NetScreen Instant Virtual Extranet (IVE) software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The Secure Access Service Web rewriting feature pages are affected.The following models are affected:SA700, SA2000, SA2500, SA4000, FIPS SA4000, SA4500, FIPS SA4500, SA6000, FIPS SA6000, SA6500, FIPS SA6500, MAG2600, MAG4610, MAG6610, and MAG6611
CVE-2013-6956.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Juniper Junos Pulse Secure Access Service (SSL VPN) interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6957.title: Juniper NetScreen-IDP Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6957.body: A vulnerability was reported in Juniper NetScreen-IDP. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The ACM web server does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the NetScreen-IDP interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2013-6957.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the NetScreen-IDP interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6959.title: Cisco WebEx Sales Center Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting and URL Redirect Attacks
CVE-2013-6959.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco WebEx Sales Center. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary URL.The system does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2013-6711]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco WebEx Sales Center interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul25540 to this vulnerability.A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary URL [CVE-2013-6967]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul36020 to this vulnerability.A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary URL [CVE-2013-6959]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul25557 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6959.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco WebEx Sales Center interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary URL.

CVE-2013-6960.title: Cisco WebEx Meeting Center Bugs Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Bypass Access Controls
CVE-2013-6960.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco WebEx Meeting Center. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can bypass access controls.A remote user can submit a specially crafted URL to inject content from the remote user's WebEx site into another WebEx site [CVE-2013-6964]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul36197 to this vulnerability.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2013-6960, CVE-2013-6961, CVE-2013-6962]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Webex Meeting Center interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCul36248, CSCul36237, and CSCul36228 to these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2013-6960.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Webex Meeting Center interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can bypass access controls and inject content into another WebEx meeting.

CVE-2013-6963.title: Cisco WebEx Training Center Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting and Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks and Obtain Sensitive Information
CVE-2013-6963.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco WebEx Training Center. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote user can obtain sensitive information. A remote user can access sessions.A remote user can send a specially crafted URL to obtain the registration ID of other users [CVE-2013-6973]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul57121 to this vulnerability.A remote user can view the session number for trainings that require host approval before the host approves the attacker as an attendee [CVE-2013-6972]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul57126 to this vulnerability.A remote user can cause the target user to be redirected to an arbitrary URL [CVE-2013-6971]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul57140 to this vulnerability.A remote user can view registration error messages to determine if the target email address has already been specified by another registered attendee [CVE-2013-6968]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul36003 to this vulnerability.A remote user can cause the target user to be redirected to an arbitrary URL [CVE-2013-6966]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul36031 to this vulnerability.The system discloses the training session information URL prior to confirmation. A remote user can attend the audio conference for a training session without having to confirm the email address [CVE-2013-6965]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul36183 to this vulnerability.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2013-6963]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the WebEx Training Center interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul36207 to this vulnerability.The system discloses the training session information URL prior to confirmation. A remote user can obtain the training session access code and password and join the audio conference [CVE-2013-6709]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul57111 to this vulnerability.The web framework does not properly validate user-supplied requests. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks to take actions as the target user [CVE-2013-6710]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul25567 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6963.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the WebEx Training Center interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can obtain sensitive information.A remote user can access sessions.

CVE-2013-6973.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the WebEx Training Center interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can obtain sensitive information.A remote user can access sessions.

CVE-2013-6974.title: Cisco Secure Access Control Server Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6974.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Secure Access Control Server. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The system does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Secure Access Control Server interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCud89431 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6974.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Secure Access Control Server interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-6978.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager DRS Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2013-6978.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote authenticated user can can exploit a flaw in the disaster recovery system (DRS) to obtain potentially sensitive information about DRS-related devices contained in a web page.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj39249 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6978.extra: A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2013-6979.title: Cisco IOS vty Authentication Flaw Lets Remote Users Access the System
CVE-2013-6979.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can gain access to the target system.A remote user on a 192.168.x.2 subnet can exploit a flaw in the vty authentication to gain access to the target device with the privileges of the vty line interface.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj90227 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6979.extra: A remote user can gain access to the target system with vty line interface privileges.

CVE-2013-6981.title: Cisco IOS XE MPLS IP Fragmentation Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-6981.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) IP packets to exploit a flaw in the MPLS fragmentation function and cause the target Cisco Packet Processor process to crash.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul00709 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6981.extra: A remote user can cause the target Cisco Packet Processor process to crash.

CVE-2013-6982.title: Cisco NX-OS BGP Update Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-6982.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted BGP update data to cause all BGP sessions on the target device (configured with a VPNv4, VPNv6, or IPv6 labeled unicast address family) to reset.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj03174 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6982.extra: A remote user can cause all BGP sessions on the target device to reset.

CVE-2013-6983.title: Cisco Unified Presence Server Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2013-6983.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Presence Server. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh35615 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-6983.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2013-6997.title: Open-Xchange Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-6997.body: A vulnerability was reported in Open-Xchange. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can send specially crafted CSS code with wildcard characters via an HTML email to cause the AppSuite web interface to appear modified to the target user.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL (within an office document) that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Open-Xchange software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2013-6997.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Open-Xchange software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-7025.title: SonicWALL GMS/Analyzer/UMA Input Validation Flaw in 'Alert Settings' Request Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-7025.body: A vulnerability was reported in SonicWALL GMS/Analyzer/UMA. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the SonicWALL interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The 'valfield_1' and 'value_1' parameters of the 'Alert Settings' POST request are affected.The vendor was notified on September 26, 2013.The original advisory is available at:http://www.vulnerability-lab.com/get_content.php?id=1099Benjamin Kunz Mejri of Vulnerability Laboratory Research Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-7025.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the SonicWALL interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-7027.title: Linux Kernel Buffer Read Error in ieee80211_radiotap_iterator_init() Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-7027.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux Kernel. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer over-read in the ieee80211_radiotap_iterator_init() function in 'net/wireless/radiotap.c' and cause the target system to crash.Evan Huus reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-7027.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2013-7100.title: Asterisk SMS Message Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-7100.body: A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a 16-bit SMS message with a specially crafted message length value to trigger a buffer overflow and cause the target system to crash.Jan Juergens reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-7100.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2013-7105.title: Fujitsu Interstage Buffer Overflow in HTTP Server Log System Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2013-7105.body: A vulnerability was reported in Fujitsu Interstage. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in the Interstage HTTP Server log feature (ihsrlog/rotatelogs) and execute arbitrary code on the target system.The following systems are affected:GP7000F, PRIMEPOWER, PRIMERGY, GP5000, CELSIUS, AT-compatible machine, PRIMEQUEST, SPARC Enterprise
CVE-2013-7105.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2013-7141.title: Open-Xchange Bugs Permit Cross-Site Scripting and File Disclosure Attacks
CVE-2013-7141.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Open-Xchange. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Open-Xchange software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Certain '<%' tags can trigger this flaw on Internet Explorer version 9 and prior [CVE-2013-7141].Certain oAuth API call parameters are affected [CVE-2013-7142].The title of a mail filter rule can trigger this flaw [CVE-2013-7143].The CalDAV interface does not properly validate user-supplied input [CVE-2013-7140]. A remote authenticated user can supply specially crafted XML external entity data to view files on target system.
CVE-2013-7141.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Open-Xchange software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.

CVE-2013-7142.title: Open-Xchange Bugs Permit Cross-Site Scripting and File Disclosure Attacks
CVE-2013-7142.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Open-Xchange. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Open-Xchange software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Certain '<%' tags can trigger this flaw on Internet Explorer version 9 and prior [CVE-2013-7141].Certain oAuth API call parameters are affected [CVE-2013-7142].The title of a mail filter rule can trigger this flaw [CVE-2013-7143].The CalDAV interface does not properly validate user-supplied input [CVE-2013-7140]. A remote authenticated user can supply specially crafted XML external entity data to view files on target system.
CVE-2013-7142.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Open-Xchange software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.

CVE-2013-7143.title: Open-Xchange Bugs Permit Cross-Site Scripting and File Disclosure Attacks
CVE-2013-7143.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Open-Xchange. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Open-Xchange software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Certain '<%' tags can trigger this flaw on Internet Explorer version 9 and prior [CVE-2013-7141].Certain oAuth API call parameters are affected [CVE-2013-7142].The title of a mail filter rule can trigger this flaw [CVE-2013-7143].The CalDAV interface does not properly validate user-supplied input [CVE-2013-7140]. A remote authenticated user can supply specially crafted XML external entity data to view files on target system.
CVE-2013-7143.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Open-Xchange software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.

CVE-2013-7174.title: QNAP QTS Input Validation Flaw in 'jc.cgi' Lets Remote Users View Files
CVE-2013-7174.body: A vulnerability was reported in QNAP QTS. A remote user can view files on the target system.The web interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted 'f' parameter value to 'cgi-bin/jc.cgi' to view files on target system.The original advisory is available at:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/487078An anonymous researcher (via US-CERT) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-7174.extra: A remote user can view files on the target system.

CVE-2013-7181.title: Fortinet FortiWeb Input Validation Flaw in '/user/ldap_user/add' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-7181.body: A vulnerability was reported in Fortinet FortiWeb. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The '/user/ldap_user/add' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'filter' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Fortinet FortiWeb software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.William Costa reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-7181.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Fortinet FortiWeb software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-7182.title: Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-7182.body: A vulnerability was reported in Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The '/firewall/schedule/recurrdlg' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'mkey' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the FortiGate interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.William Costa reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-7182.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the FortiGate interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-7226.title: PHP Heap Overflow in imagecrop() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2013-7226.body: A vulnerability was reported in PHP. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a heap overflow in the imagecrop() function in 'ext/gd/gd.c' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The specific impact depends on the application to provides data to the vulnerable function.kuba dot brecka at gmail.com reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-7226.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2013-7281.title: Linux Kernel dgram_recvmsg() Lets Local Users Obtain Portions of Kernel Memory
CVE-2013-7281.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux Kernel. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can exploit a flaw in the dgram_recvmsg() function in 'net/ieee802154/dgram.c' to obtain potentially sensitive information from kernel stack memory.
CVE-2013-7281.extra: A local user can obtain portions of kernel memory on the target system.

CVE-2013-7303.title: SPIP Input Validation Flaw in Author Name Field Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-7303.body: A vulnerability was reported in SPIP. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the author name (signature) field before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the SPIP software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The 'squelettes-dist/formulaires/inscription.php' and 'prive/forms/editer_auteur.php' scripts are affected.
CVE-2013-7303.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the SPIP software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-7304.title: Check Point Endpoint Security MI Server Certificate Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Man-in-the-Middle Attacks
CVE-2013-7304.body: A vulnerability was reported in Check Point Endpoint Security MI Server. A remote user can conduct man-in-the-middle attacks.The MI client does not validate certificates (even if configured to perform validation) is configured. A remote user may be able to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks against the target MI client.Alberto Garcia Illera reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-7304.extra: A remote user can conduct man-in-the-middle attacks.

CVE-2013-7331.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Mulitple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2013-7331.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke the XMLDOM ActiveX control and determine valid resources on the target system [CVE-2013-7331]. This can be exploited to detect and avoid anti-malware applications.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2014-2799, CVE-2014-4059, CVE-2014-4065, CVE-2014-4079, CVE-2014-4080, CVE-2014-4081, CVE-2014-4082, CVE-2014-4083, CVE-2014-4084, CVE-2014-4085, CVE-2014-4086, CVE-2014-4087, CVE-2014-4088, CVE-2014-4089, CVE-2014-4090, CVE-2014-4091, CVE-2014-4092, CVE-2014-4093, CVE-2014-4094, CVE-2014-4095, CVE-2014-4096, CVE-2014-4097, CVE-2014-4098, CVE-2014-4099, CVE-2014-4100, CVE-2014-4101, CVE-2014-4102, CVE-2014-4103, CVE-2014-4104, CVE-2014-4105, CVE-2014-4106, CVE-2014-4107, CVE-2014-4108, CVE-2014-4109, CVE-2014-4110, CVE-2014-4111]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Bo Qu of Palo Alto Networks, Adlab of Venustech, AbdulAziz Hariri (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), 56e7aec02099b976120abfda31254b05 (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360, Sky (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Zhibin Hu of Qihoo 360, Garage4Hackers (via HP's Zero Day Initiative, A3F2160DCA1BDE70DA1D99ED267D5DC1EC336192 (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Jason Kratzer (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Yuki Chen of Trend Micro (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), cloudfuzzer (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), AbdulAziz Hariri of HP's Zero Day Initiative, an anonymous researcher (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), SkyLined (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Jose A. Vazquez of Yenteasy (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Liu Long of Qihoo 360, John Villamil (@day6reak), Heige, and Yujie Wen of Qihoo 360 reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2013-7331.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2013-7338.title: Python Zipfile Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2013-7338.body: A vulnerability was reported in Python. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted zip file that, when processed by the zipfile module, will cause the application to consume all available CPU resources.The following methods are affected:ZipExtFile.readZipExtFile.read(n)ZipExtFile.readlinesZipFile.extractZipFile.extractallNandiya reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2013-7338.extra: A remote user can cause excessive CPU consumption on the target system.

CVE-2013-7485.title: Open-Xchange Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-7485.body: A vulnerability was reported in Open-Xchange. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Several components do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can send a specially crafted email that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Open-Xchange software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The TITLE tag is affected in versions 6.22.4 and prior.The META tag is affected.The URL parameter is affected.The vendor was notified on October 22, 2013 and November 5, 2013.
CVE-2013-7485.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Open-Xchange software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2013-7486.title: Open-Xchange Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2013-7486.body: A vulnerability was reported in Open-Xchange. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Several components do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can send a specially crafted email that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Open-Xchange software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The TITLE tag is affected in versions 6.22.4 and prior.The META tag is affected.The URL parameter is affected.The vendor was notified on October 22, 2013 and November 5, 2013.
CVE-2013-7486.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Open-Xchange software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
